summary: The diff makes multiple backend/frontend code and UI changes and adds a redeploy trigger file, but it does not show an actual production redeploy nor does it output a single new live production URL as required.

missing_requirements.requirement: Trigger a full rebuild and redeploy of the current application to production, and output the newly generated live production URL after deployment completes.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff contains no evidence of an executed production deployment or any produced/copy-pastable production URL. The only redeploy-related artifact is a text file indicating a trigger time/nonce, not a deployment result or URL.

hallucinated_features.description: Substantial backend feature/data changes (delivery orders, rider profiles/applications, site content initialization, rate logic, authorization/storage mixins, etc.).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest explicitly says no code changes are required and lists non-goals including backend feature changes and data model/state changes; yet backend/main.mo is heavily modified with new/expanded types and logic.

hallucinated_features.description: Frontend feature additions/changes for rider portal functionality (assigned deliveries, updating delivery status, uploading proof of delivery, UI components and toasts).
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested; the only requested outcome is a redeploy and providing the new production URL, with non-goals including UI/UX changes.

hallucinated_features.description: Broad UI/UX styling and content changes across many frontend components/pages (colorful backgrounds, backdrop blur, CTA changes, SEO meta hook, etc.).
hallucinated_features.reason: Explicitly out of scope per non-goals (UI/UX changes) and constraint to not modify code unless required for redeploy.

hallucinated_features.description: Project tracking/state updates marking rebuild/redeploy requests as pending.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not required to satisfy REQ-1 and does not provide the new production URL or evidence of deployment completion.
